explanation: Agent A is correct. The code calls strlen(username) and strlen(realm) in MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest and strlen(password) inside digest_update_str without any validation that those pointers are non-NULL and point to NUL-terminated objects. strlen can read past the object bounds (or dereference NULL), so the use of the <string.h> function can result in out-of-bounds accesses and undefined behaviour. Although the provided call sites (add_new_user_entry) use string literals (which are safe), the reviewed functions themselves do not enforce or check the required preconditions. Unless there is an externally guaranteed, documented and enforced API contract that these pointers are always non-NULL and NUL-terminated, this is a violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
